subject: Broken spring piece in throttle
description_text:
Hello, I've had my pedals for about 5 months now, I've used them on and off
for about 4 of those months after initially dealing with a control box that
didn't work correctly until opening it up and seeing two loose wires.

Now my throttle sensor, the spring on the very front of the throttle pedal,
has broken in half because it's made of some type of ABS plastic. This is
unacceptable for a product to break in 5 months that is supposedly all
steel construction based on your own product description. How exactly is
this even fixable? Note, I have not messed with my pedals, I threw them on
my rig, I don't adjust them in any way except to add/remove the damper.
There is no way in the software to get rid of the spring part of the
throttle, meaning the first 1/2 of my pedal movement registers *nothing*.
Basically bricking my pedals.

conversations.body_text: Hi BadDadGames,  Hello, this part is made of plastic to prevent interference issues and to avoid the base and bracket affecting the metal sensor; that’s why nylon was intentionally used instead of metal. We have upgraded this component. Previously, the blue limit adjustment at its minimum position could block the movement of the pressure plate, causing it to break. Under normal circumstances, the spring exerts only 1kg of force, which is insufficient to damage the plastic part. Please provide your order number, contact person, phone number, and shipping address, and we will send you the upgraded plastic replacement part to prevent this issue from occurring again.

It was ordered via Amazon my address is 49 central street athol ma 01331,
is the part coming from China ? What kind of time  span can I expect? I’m
supposed to be competing in the iracing nxt series next two weeks. Here is
my order #my name is Ian street, it broke because of the blue limiter.
